website_summaries.verdict: It's a well-built appliance, but some of the features that users love the most are also available on less costly, more effective models.
pros: Offers variable speed settings, 10-amp motor, and 60-ounce clear container for producing fairly large volumes (up to 24 cups in 8 minutes)
Motor is backed by a 6-year limited warranty
cons: Some owners are disappointed with the amount of dust it emits and how noisy it is during grinding

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with product that performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We use this product to grind wheat berries for making bread. We are able to grind enough wheat to share with our daughter and one or two friends. One couple uses freshly ground wheat to create the world's most excellent waffles. Several of us older retired folks appreciate the health benefits of ground wheat berries.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Cory

customer_reviews.title: Be ready for a big cleanup
customer_reviews.text: I tried oats, crushed thoroughly dry rose petals, and a couple of other things that it should have ground nicely but it takes a long time to grind, the area where the product goes into the mill is so small it's about the size of the end of my finger. But the worst part is that I am still cleaning up dust everywhere and when I saw it happening, I took the top off, checked the instructions again and put it on exactly like they said. I need a mill but definitely not this one. I don't like giving bad reviews but this product truly deserves one. Sorry, but that's what happened.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Worked admirably!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, no frills, and grinds grain into the finst flour you've ever made. Selectable settings for finer or more coarse flour. Yeah, the clips on the bucket may break. Just use extreme caution seating the unit in, and pulling it off the bucket. Yeah, it sounds like a jet engine, only louder. Silent operation is not what I bought it for, and it's not on that long, anyway. It is absolutely superb as a grain mill and for the money, it simply cannot be beat! I would strongly recommend it as a purchase, and advise one to learn to ignore the noise, and handle it gently, and you'll come to love this grain mill.
customer_reviews.author: Bob J.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Very loud and produces a lot of residue ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very loud and produces a lot of residue dust, but that is expected when pulverizing grains, etc. Always use outside and just remove the little foam air filter. It will clog up in no time and is not necessary if your outside anyway. If you are celiac, like my kids, you will save a fortune making your own rice, millet, etc flour with this machine. Expensive, but would buy again, as it will pay for itself in a short time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Belknap

customer_reviews.title: Great mill for the price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on recommendation of friends and other written reviews. It is noisy but not as bad as a 777 reving for takeoff...as stated in one review. ( I used to live near Boeing) It handles many grains and grinds them to specified finess. I have had a little trouble with as the "in" area starts to get empty, some grains fly out into the room as they approach the teeth but I have solved this by just putting a paper over the intake as it gets empty. This is my first grain mill so I cannot compare it to other machines. This gets the job done for me at a good price...I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Lott

customer_reviews.title: Works well but has plastic bits that come off
customer_reviews.text: Works quite well till the plastic dial to determine course was broke off rendering it useless. It did mill fairly fine but not superfine flour (I do all sorts of wheats). It's rather annoying to clean out after use so for me this was a larger batch milling machine, once a week or so rather than a few handfuls for the moment. Blendtec has a fantastic 8 year warrenty and will be fixing it, but it will take a few weeks
customer_reviews.author: RJJ

customer_reviews.title: Love my new mill
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a few times and love how quickly and efficiently it works. I can mill 2 cups of wheat berries in less than a minute. Like many other reviewers noted, it is a bit loud but given how quickly it works, it's not too big of an issue. I looked at many other mills before selecting this one. For the money, this one was a good value plus I like the way everything can be packed up into a relatively compact space.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean head, accumulates gunk
customer_reviews.text: We actually ended up reselling this as we bought an Omega masticating juicer that can grind grains, coffee etc also. This was ok. Very loud, heats up pretty good and you end up losing some as lots gets stuck in the milling mechanism. Ok. Would just stick with the Omega juicer. It can do so manythings over this guy- juice, oil extractor, nut butters, puree, sorbet, pasta, grind meats, beans and grains... Wouldn't buy this again- not because it was terrible, but just because I now know there are much better options.
customer_reviews.author: Mamma Manda

customer_reviews.title: all arrived in good condition. Only problem with this purchase for me ...
customer_reviews.text: all arrived in good condition. Only problem with this purchase for me was that there was no manual or paperwork at all with order. Told me to read instructions before turning on, but...... no instructions..... had to go to Blendtec website and download manual
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not That Loud
customer_reviews.text: This mill works beautifully. I love, love, love it. To me, it's really not that loud. After reading several reviews about the noise I expected the sound of jet engines taking off right in the kitchen, but no. It's a bit louder than the vaccum cleaner. It's not like you're going to mill wheat for hours at a time, anyway, so don't let that stop you. I also don't get the complaints about the clasps breaking off. I can't see that happening unless you yank on the sucker. Great product! I would buy a BlendTec Kitchen Mill again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is a 'mill' that grinds up grain into flour. Works pretty good. I have used it mostly to grind 'steel cut' and 'old fashioned' oats into flour. Works great for both, as the flour is fine. It will dust your area where you use it. The little F shaped filter that was supposed to come with it, didn't. I called the company, they sent me 2 for free. I use it about once a month, so far works great except for the mess. So I now use it outside where I don't have to dust.
customer_reviews.author: fixitpro

customer_reviews.title: Good, fast and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This mill works very well. It grinds the flour fast. And is big enough for my purposes. A Caution to those with sensitive hearing...this unit is Very Loud. I recommend ear plugs. The second time I used it, I covered it with a lightweight towel to help muffle the sound and contain the few little puffs of flour that escape during the grinding. Loss of star is for the noise.
customer_reviews.author: another reviewer

customer_reviews.title: We got our Blentec in time for the Super Bowl, and my wife made pizza
customer_reviews.text: We got our Blentec in time for the Super Bowl, and my wife made pizza. She ground wheat, barley, oats, and spelt in equal amounts. The pizza dough was great! We have been grinding our grain for many years; so much that our grinder that attaches to our mixer quit working. The blentec makes very fine flour, which is what we wanted. It is finer than the whole wheat flour that we have gotten from Walmart, which is commercially ground.
customer_reviews.author: M D Duhon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my grain mill. I've been using it once a week since I bought it several weeks ago. I've been soaking and/or sprouting grains, dehydrating them, and then milling them. So far I've been playing with different varieties of wheat berries but I have rice and barley on the list next. Super easy to use, easy to clean, not too big in terms of storage. It is loud but that is to be expected..
customer_reviews.author: rmily

customer_reviews.title: Wow great mill!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mill, it has a really good warranty! The only downside I see is the locking tabs on the chamber are a bit hard to manipulate. Otherwise on the whole its a great appliance. I have milled flax seed, and buckwheat on it. Done in just a few minutes. But according to the instructions it is not a good idea to mill nuts. I'm guessing because of the oil content it would gum up the blades! But that's ok, because I also have the Blendtec blender which I am able to use on the nuts! More than happy with both products!
customer_reviews.author: marie germain

customer_reviews.title: We love this for grinding our own wheat for bread
customer_reviews.text: We love this for grinding our own wheat for bread. It does a nice job as long as it isn't overloaded. We have learned that we have to blow it out with an air compressor if we aren't going to use it for awhile, or the oil in the kernels starts to go rancid.
customer_reviews.author: MNilsson

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I have never thought about grinding my own grains, but this makes it so easy!! The bread I can make is out of this world and I suggest anyone that loves to bake, use this. You can use soft winter wheat berries to make the best pie crust and hard winter wheat is hard to beat for just a great loaf of bread. I have used to make other flour for things like waffles, middle eastern foods, and gluten free stuff like hemp bread (DO NOT grind the hemp seeds!).
customer_reviews.author: Cfarmer

customer_reviews.title: BEST HOME GRAIN MILL!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mill! I bought it after having purchased a more expensive mill (the Nutrimill; almost $100 more). I used the other mill a lot, but never could get WHOLE wheat bread to turn out any better than a building brick. I always had to add white flour for my bread to be edible. So a friend recommended this one. I sold my Nutrimill and bought this one and I LOVE it. The flour is much finer, resulting in beautiful, fluffy, WHOLE wheat bread! The mill is a little bit louder than the other one, but not much. I would definately recommend this mill to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: G. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. I can buy 50 pounds of spelt berries to make bread which saves a lot of money than buying spelt flour at the store. It does heat up the flour some but not too much. I still get good results with the bread. It is loud and a little messy to use but much better than an attachment I used that fit on my Champion juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. H

customer_reviews.title: Durable and adjustable flour fineness. Processes a variety of seeds and grains.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Kitchen Mill (the first one was stolen) and they work very very well. You can control how fine the flour is, and they will process a variety of seeds and grains. They are durable, don't overheat, and well they just work!
customer_reviews.author: Zootal

customer_reviews.title: Blendtec - The Kitchen Mill by KTEC
customer_reviews.text: I very much like the mill. I have used it to mill red and white wheat and am very pleased with the flour it produces. I can make a very finely textured flour. Half of my family does not like whole wheat products but finds baked goods made with the flour I mill acceptable. I personally find the whole wheat four I mill easier to work with than commercially milled flour. In addition, the baked products I make with the flour I mill are more tasty than what I can make with commercially milled flour. I knew what to expect with the mill; it exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Linda N.

customer_reviews.title: If you want to get one this is it.
customer_reviews.text: My wife is new to grain milling and was not sure which one to get. She was whatching a video on bread making and they used this in the video. I would have to say she has been very pleased with it. It is loud, Since this is her first one I am not sure how it rates in sound compared to others. If you want to try grinding your own grain this would be a perfect one to start with.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: very pleased; good value
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grain mill for about a month. I've used it at least once a week, to grind wheat berries and popcorn (for corn meal) so far. I especially like that it can produce really fine flour or a coarser meal, as needed. I've had no trouble with the side latches which some other reviewers complained about. It isn't extremely noisy, in my opinion. The mill stores easily in a cupboard. I also love the little label on the bottom of the mill that states "made in USA". That is really important to me.
customer_reviews.author: d5f5r4a1

customer_reviews.title: Grinds well but serious reservations
customer_reviews.text: This wheat grinder is hard to clean. It also spews dust when it's grinding. So it is very annoying. I'm replacing it with a neater model. I would not recommend this wheat grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable product!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this wonderful flour mill for nearly a year. I use it to mill Red Winter Wheat Berries to make fresh, healthy bread for my family. I LOVE this mill! It is compact, stores easily and is easy enough to clean, all you need is a dry pastry brush to brush the access flour off. Thank you for making such a remarkable product!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Grau

customer_reviews.title: Wheat grinder
customer_reviews.text: So far very pleased. I can see where the plastic clips could be damaged if you aren't careful. The unit is mostly plastic and does look kind of fragile. It is loud like some have said. I does go a real good job grinding the wheat and is less than half price other grinders I have looked at.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the KTEC grain mill about two years ago and have been very satisfied with it. We use it frequently to grind hard spring wheat for making bread or pizza. It runs at a very high speed and is loud, similar to an electric router one may use for wood working. It will likely cause small children or pets to evacuate from the kitchen, but you will be pleased with the ease of operation and results.
customer_reviews.author: R. Foster

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Don't be fooled by the cute names ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Blendtec. I love it. Don't be fooled by the cute names of other mills (whispermill) - ain't none of them quiet! But this is good, fits nicely in cabinets (as opposed to round mills) works well.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Loud, but fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: This is our first mill and we absolutely love it! Yes, it's loud, but the flour is super-fine and can be used for even the most delicate baking. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this mill a few times so far. I've used it to grind wheat and also popcorn to make cornmeal. It has done it's job so far. The only problems I have with it are how loud it is and that the top doesn't seal very well so you have to hold it down to keep from having flour shoot out the sides. But, for the price, I can deal with that!
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I tried the Kitchenaid attachment, and had bad luck with it. This gets a really fine flour, and cleanup is very easy. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Baker214

customer_reviews.title: Our little jet engine.
customer_reviews.text: It's actually not as loud as we'd assumed. Works very well at milling various grains quickly into extremely fine flour (or whatever you're milling) We're still trying to figure out a better cleaning procedure for it. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Munsell

customer_reviews.title: In all I love it, just seems as if the manufacturing is ...
customer_reviews.text: Is it normal that the filter (vent) is not lining up and that the top needs extreme pressure to latch? I'm afraid to break off the latches when taking it off, it is extremely hard to take off. In all I love it, just seems as if the manufacturing is not the best quality.
customer_reviews.author: Maria McCracken

customer_reviews.title: A little loud, but quick at grinding, also ...
customer_reviews.text: A little loud, but quick at grinding, also get two filters and change them if grinding a lot at once.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wells

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to, and does it well! If you want to make your own flour from any dry seed or bean or grain, this is what you want. (no moist nuts like almonds and it claims not to work with coffee beans)
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy and convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Grinds out quinoa at a rate of about 6-7 cups every 2-3 minutes!! Fills up fast at that rate, but it will hold a full 16 oz bag of quinoa so I don't need anything bigger. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Smith

customer_reviews.title: My Big Brother
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this as a gift for my big brother and he was so grateful for it. He started using it immediately making my wife and I a sweet potato pie. I had already purchased my wife the same name and model of miller and she has been using it hard core for the last year or so to make our bread. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Andres R. Bodon

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed, as I made sure that it was on ...
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed, as I made sure that it was on tightly I began to grinding my beans for flour dust started coming out going all over my kitchen, the clean up took some time.I will no longer use it for the dust bothered my allergies as well. I wish I could send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah W.

customer_reviews.title: this Kitchen Mill is amazing. A bit loud but it does a great ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this Kitchen Mill is amazing. A bit loud but it does a great job. I haven't had any problems with flour dust on my countertops yet.
customer_reviews.author: Catleya Wizebrowne

customer_reviews.title: Save money!!
customer_reviews.text: Save the money and get this over the more expensive popular mills. I've had this for 5 months and love it. I mill all ny own flour for all my baking needs. I have had zero problems!
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Love my Blendtec
customer_reviews.text: After plenty of research I purchased the Blendtec. It arrived promptly and I put it to immediate use. Although other reviews remarked that it sounds like a jet engine and one even went so far as to say you might want to use ear protection I found that to be quite an exaggeration. Yes, it's loud but it's also very fast so the noise does not last long. The resulting flour is very fine and I am completely satisfied with the Blendtec.
customer_reviews.author: Ann H Smith

customer_reviews.title: agree with what I read from other reviews
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the reviews I read before purchasing the Blentec Grain Mill. It works great and is a bit loud, but not unbearably so. I find the cleanup a bit of a hassle but only because it's flour and can get messy. The mill is simple to use and very convenient to have. I love having it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Paligo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The only thing we would change is the noise. Don't know whether that's possible
customer_reviews.author: Tell Sackett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool for grinding whole grains
customer_reviews.text: This grain mill is great. It has ground everything we have thrown at it. My wife loves being able to cook with grains that we grow on the farm.
customer_reviews.author: IMA_Redneck

customer_reviews.title: Produces coarse-ish (not fine) Gluten free (rice) flour
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it works fine for wheat, but not so well for rice. It mills it into a coarse texture, sorta like Bob's Red Mill's rice flour. I guess it's not meant for gluten free flours.
customer_reviews.author: Hello Everyone

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It's not as noisy as others have said. It works well, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Stowe

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: blew flour everywhere, but I was given no hassle returning the item, so I was appreciative of that consideration
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am please with the speed and with the texture of the milled flour. It is pretty loud though, so you may want to use ear plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie S. Plath

customer_reviews.title: Electric Grain Mill - just what we were looking for!
customer_reviews.text: We have used it almost daily since receiving it two weeks ago! We have tried different recipes - all the more scrumptious when made with freshly ground whole wheat flour!
customer_reviews.author: SC Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for every baker/ cook who likes ingredients fresh
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mill. Hesitated a lot before buying it. But I am very pleased with how it works. Should have bought it earlier
customer_reviews.author: Lopa Rana

customer_reviews.title: bought it for my wife thinking it was 2nd rate. it's fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: fantastic entry-level grinder. it makes fine, bread quality flour on the middle setting. Still waiting for her to try fine so she'll make pastries... :)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: My husband is very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: The mill does the job well but it quite loud. The noise doesn't bother us, but it is loud. No problems with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: clott

customer_reviews.title: Love this !
customer_reviews.text: Works great this is the second one I have owned! Down side- it is very loud and the dust from the flour escapes the container I try to set this up outside when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Karin

customer_reviews.title: everything worked fine, except the cone that goes in the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: everything worked fine, except the cone that goes in the bottom keeps falling out when the unit is turned on. It won't seal right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Grinder
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit noisy (as are all wheat grinders) and flour flies everywhere, but it grinds quickly and the flour is very fine. Not good if you want to just crack the wheat, but good for bread flours.
customer_reviews.author: Mara Bitters

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I had this same grinder, originally by a company called Kitchenetiks, for 23 years. It was my Dad's before that. I ground a lot of wheat and corn in it. I was so happy to find the same one again. It works just as good and I hope it lasts as long.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Russell

customer_reviews.title: Baker's Flour!
customer_reviews.text: The product turns hard red wheat into baker's flour; what more can be said. Yes, it is loud when it's done grinding but all you have to do is turn it off. Also, they delivered before the promised arrival date...during CHRISTmas too!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse VanHoose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mill. Does the job as described. Grinds coarse and very fine. Will recommend to friends and relatives. Due to powerful motor becomes hot after a pound and a half and needs to cool.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Tassev

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder
customer_reviews.text: We got this grinder to make corn flour, and it works great! It mills the corn very fine, you wouldn't even know it was corn! I would highly recommend this grinder!
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Made fresh cornbread.
customer_reviews.text: It done what it said it would do. I ground my own cornmeal with it and made cornbread the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Hughes

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: the flour leaks out all over as it grinds between the grinder and the bin. Not pleased
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Frey

customer_reviews.title: blendtec grain mill
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It works fast and isn't too loud. It isn't too large so it is easy to store and just get out when needed. I've used it at least once a week since I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome performance!!! The mill did what the company said it will do. The flour I made was like silk. I will keep using this mill till it dies.
customer_reviews.author: SherryCT

customer_reviews.title: Cornbread is finally within my grasp again!
customer_reviews.text: No cornmeal in the Philippines worth eating, but plenty of corn. And after some really funny looks at airport security checkpoints, I'm in business!
customer_reviews.author: James Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Use it ALL the time, love it! Have had no problems, good price as grain mills go, a little loud, but I expected it to be so it's no problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid Kitchen Mill
customer_reviews.text: My mom had one of these for about 14 years made by a company called magic mill. This is the exact design and infact the flour holder from her old mill fits the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Data Le

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this grinder. Its the best I don't think is very noisy and although you get dirty because you are dealing with flour the machine works just fine I give it a 10
customer_reviews.author: Nestor/10

customer_reviews.title: perfect milling for home use...
customer_reviews.text: I researched long time to buy Kitchen mill. I decided go to cheapest One this way if it can not meet my expectations, I can put a side It,not hurt to much. This one beyond what I hope for. I definitely Recommended anyone who want to make any kind of flour...
customer_reviews.author: Demir

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's an awesome product! Super fast and not too terribly messy to clean up after. Grinds the flour very fine. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Whole Wheat Potato Donuts!
customer_reviews.text: The Blendtec Kitchen Mill is terrific for grinding wheat for my famous WW potato donuts. Just like magic. Donut Lady
customer_reviews.author: Donut Lady

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: have only used the mill once, but it meets all expectations, the bread was delicious, texture wa great, will use often
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best little mill I ever used.really gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: vonda

customer_reviews.title: Love my grain mill
customer_reviews.text: The Blendtec grain mill works wonderfully. It sounds like a jet engine, but all that power is harnessed into milling wheat into fine flour. After years of using a hand mill this is heaven!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Electirc Flour Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, it grinds the wheat quickly but it is so loud! Be prepared when you turn it on, it sounds like a plane taking off.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I had never used one of these and a friend of mine was making home made bread with a great flavor. She told me about this machine and I bought one. I have been using it and getting great bread myself. It is easy to use but I wish it had better instructions as to the grind and the weight of the flour. Other than that I would buy another. Deborah Davis
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Reinhold

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review
customer_reviews.text: The Blendtec Kitchen Mill is quick to grind the grain, but it is very difficult to open. It is also messy to use since it is not sealed on the top and the filter is exposed on the side.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hersey

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful motor, TERRIBLE design!
customer_reviews.text: i loved this mill when I first purchased it. It grinds wheat down to a very fine, powdery flour. I make a lot of bread for my family of 6 and used it quite often. It's a loud motor, which I don't really mind, but the top is held on with the flimsiest of plastic little tabs, which will definitely break off at some point. And there is no way to replace them, because they are part of the motor housing, it's all one piece. I have to use it outside now because it spews so much flour everywhere when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: David Pickard

customer_reviews.title: Great small Grinder.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for several years and I am very happy with this purchase. I did have a bit of trouble with it not grinding quickly and customer service was great. They walked me through the process of cleaning out a filter and the grinder was back to normal. The only draw back to this is that there is some dust. We just try to keep it covered with something when it is grinding on the top (usually just sheet of paper) and that seems to help. I love being able to grind my own rice, wheat or beans and it is fairly small so it works great for our small kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: T.Neff

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Flour covered my kitchen whenever I used it. It ground it decent but it took forever to clean up after! Not worth it. I returned it
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Gillette

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The clips that hold the lid on break pretty easily which renders the entire unit useless. Major design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: B.P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Mill
customer_reviews.text: I have a Blendtec kitchen mill that must be at least 20 years old. I have never had any problems with it. The mill is loud...that is for sure. But it really does the job. My children used to love helping me feed wheat into the hopper so we could make bread with the ground flour. My daughter is now a mother of her own and I just bought one of these for her--as she still loves to make homemade bread. This is a good product and I would not hesitate to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Northland

customer_reviews.title: I have loved this machine
customer_reviews.text: I make bread about every 10 days. I have loved this machine! I have noticed that throwing three cups of wheat in at once can cause it to jam, so I just put in 1/2 cup at a time while I prepare everything else. Also, cleaning the F filter after every use is very important. I don't mean washing it, but brushing it off. Some have complained about the clips on the sides breaking, so I've handled them with care being especially careful to snap one at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Stac

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: As a total newbie to the world of home milling flour I was a little nervous about selecting a grinder. I'm so happy with this purchase! The various settings from coarse to fine are wonderful, it quickly grinds all the flour I need and it's about as loud as my blender. The hardest part is cleaning off the mill after I grind - but I've found a pastry brush makes quick work of the cleaning. We have been enjoying the fresh flour and all the health benefits!
customer_reviews.author: Ktekla

customer_reviews.title: Grain Mill
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Best item ordered in a long time. Believe me. I never realized the difference in taste of bread made with fresh milled flour over store bought flour. This is a must have. With this machine, I have my flour in minutes when I'm ready for it. Yes it's loud, but so are my kids. I got this through Amazon.com and received it with in a few days, actually sooner than expected. Thanks Amazon for the great service.
customer_reviews.author: Geri L. Bouwman

customer_reviews.title: Great machine !
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. It does a fantastic job. As mentioned in other reviews, it is noisy, but I was prepared for that and wear small foam ear plugs for the short time the machine is running and that works fine. I have NOT experienced any of the dust from escaping flour that some reviewers have mentioned. It appears to be a high quality machine for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Duggo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as I'd like! It can hold about 3 cups of wheat berries at a time. When ground, I find 3 cups of berries turn into a little over 5 cups of flour. It works through them very quickly. It is quite loud, but all mills are like that. Totally satisfied with this product. It uses 1000 watts (1Kw) of power.
customer_reviews.author: lrnselfreliance

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL mill!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Kitchen Mill (actually, my neighbor and I shared it) which has worked great for close to ten years. As much as I love my friend and the whole concept of sharing, however, it was time to get a mill of my own. Although I was perfectly satisfied with the older model, I must say that this model is even better -- it is substantially quieter and faster, and is a joy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Hammel

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing machine. It is really loud though
customer_reviews.text: I just tried it and am so excited to make bread now! What an amazing machine. It is really loud though. It has to be to grind it so well. And it has different settings to make fine or course flour.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B Lisle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mill for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Both me and my wife use this mill almost daily. It has worked flawlessly. It's a bit noisy but I imagine all good mills are. The flour produced is very nice quality and can be adjusted down to a very fine level. I have recommended this to others and would buy it again myself.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Love my Blendtec kitchen mill!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Blendtec kitchen mill. I have been using it daily. I would have given it 5 stars but I think the clips to keep the motor on the base should be made of something other than plastic, it worries me that they are going to break easy. Only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Great for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Great for emergencies but not every day use. It is very noisy and the plastic bin and top housing is a little thin and cheap. It does however make great flour and is small and convenient to use. For the price i would buy another one for occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: The K-tec grain mill I purchased about four years ago functioned beautifully; I used it to grind wheat. When I learned I am gluten-intolerant, I decided to get a new mill and start fresh. The K-tec mill is now labeled "Blend-tec" and I was disappointed with its functioning. It seemed much noisier than my old mill, took MUCH longer to grind rice, and seemed to heat up more. Even though the bowl was firmly attached, flour blew out over the counter and floor. Maybe there was just a blockage of some sort; the cup that was supposed to catch extra flour remained empty. Hopefully this was just a defective machine; I plan to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Sally H. Berk

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is fast.
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is fast. Loud but tolerable. I ground beans, brown rice and red wheat berries. The flour is perfect. Cake flour will be no problem. It does NOT, however come with the DVD the add lists. It is not on the list of items in manual. Amazon please fix.
customer_reviews.author: Tim, Oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: its loud and sounds like a jet engine starting up but it is fast and powerful. The first one that was sent was not put together well at the factory (quality control).
customer_reviews.author: healingartsintl

customer_reviews.title: Blendtec 52-601-BHM Mill
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with this purchase!! I have used it and it is the best wheat/grain mill I have ever purchased. I would highly recommend this mill to anyone that wants to grind their grains fresh. It is a fair price and a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bernice

customer_reviews.title: Already paid for itself!
customer_reviews.text: This mill has more than paid for itself. I eat gluten free and mill rice and quinoa flour in it. GF flour is so expensive to buy, plus you can't match the quality of freshly milled flour! It's worked great the whole time I've owned it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: My first wheat grinder lasted 20 years. I have ...
customer_reviews.text: My first wheat grinder lasted 20 years. I have a large family and we even made and sold bread weekly in our neighborhood. I recently needed to replace, but I expect this one to be as faithful as my first one was.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly S.

customer_reviews.title: Over heats
customer_reviews.text: Product does not seem to do what it should. It started smoking. I returned the first one thinking it was a defected product but the next one that came did the same thing. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Super strong super fine mill just a little loud
customer_reviews.text: This mill grinds any grain super fast and super fine. It is just a little loud when it runs. When milling wheat for bread the doe doesn't need to rise as long, because the flower is already warm from the milling.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use! I love it. It ground up the wheat really fast and with no mess. It was noisy but it goes so fast it doesn't really matter. This is the first time I've ever used a wheat mill.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

product_meta.title: Blendtec Kitchen Mill - Electric Grain Mill - Make your own Flour - White
product_meta.description: THE FASTEST AND MOST DURABLE MILL ON THE MARKET: The Blendtec Kitchen Mill makes it easy to create healthy whole-grain flours in seconds. Blendtec has been selling their signature Grain Mill since 1979. Being the lightest, smallest, and most efficient mill in the industry - the Blendtec Kitchen Mill is sure to satisfy all of your milling needs. The powerful 1560 watt motor is strong enough to turn grains, dried beans, and other legumes into fresh wholesome flour. Produce up to 24 cups of flour in under six minutes! In addition to being designed for easy clean-up, the mill is also see through so that you can watch the process of your grains, beans, and legumes turn into flour right before your eyes!
feature_bullets: A HEALTHIER WAY TO MILL: Burst grains, dried beans, and other legumes into fresh & nutritious flour. Instead of grinding, the Blendtec Kitchen Mill uses a surgical stainless-steel Micronetic milling chamber to produce the lowest starch damaged flour (loftiest bread) at the lowest temperature and the highest output in order to preserve nutrients.

FAST OPERATION/EFFICIENT: Produces up to 24 cups of natural, whole-grain flour in under six minutes! Milling with the Kitchen Mill is the most efficient way to produce flour from: grains, soy beans, rice, popcorn, beans, and legumes (including oily soybeans, high moisture rice, hard popcorn, etc).

ADVANCED DURABLE DESIGN: The patented, stainless-steel, micronetic milling chamber never gums, jams, or glazes. The flour bin is see-through for production convenience. The mill was not designed for easy cleaning but as it turned out it is easier to clean of any of the other Mills on the market today. The Blendtec Kitchen Mill also has the least harborage areas for bacteria.

POWERFUL MOTOR/COMPACT: Burst grains with the most powerful grain mill on the market (1560 Watt commercial-grade motor). Additionally, the Kitchen Mill is the most compact (10”L x 7 3/4”H x 8 1/2”W) and lightest weight (8 lbs.) grain mill in the industry.
Included components: Kitchen Mill motor, Mill pan, Cyclone cup, 2 F-filters, Owner's manual

8 YEAR WARRANTY/MADE IN USA: Blendtec is family-owned and driven to build the best quality products - without compromise. The Blendtec Grain Mill was the first on the market and has been the most versatile home flour mill since 1979. Proudly engineered and manufactured in the USA. Purchase includes 10 year warranty.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
